results.title: Sporting scooters
results.brief_description: In the fifties, Italian manufacturers captured the unique style of the scooter with Vespa and Lambretta. Their approach to manufacturing scooters proved hugely popular. This programme take a nostalgic look at the fun enjoyed by many scooter enthusiasts of this time. It includes footage from the fifties of rallys, races and other scooter sports throughout Great Britain.

results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items covering various sports in Germany including: 1. Horse teams of four in hand. 2. Testing synthetic running shoes and sy;nthetic ski runs. 3. Stock car racing. 4. Combination flying machine and boat. 5. Breeding race horses.

results.title: Sport parade: big fish
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and Eugene W. Castle
results.brief_description: Covers tuna fishing in the Mediterranean (by netting); sail fishing in the Gulf Stream - East Coast of Florida; netting salmon; and shows whales (mammals of the sea) in the South Pacific. Narrated by Clyde Kittel.

results.title: Sport mad Woody: The Woody Woodpecker show
results.brief_description: 10 stories featuring characters created by Walter Lantz. “The Contender”: There’s $5,000 prize for beating the defending wrestling champion, The Granulator. Believing TV wrestling is a sham, Woody lays down the challenge in a variety of disguises. “Snow way out”: Knothead and Splinter become victims to shyster ski instructors on the slopes. “Hospital hijinx”: Woody places himself in hospital in an effort to get some TLC. His plan backfires when he’s allocated Head Nurse Meany. “Over the top”: Wally and Woody have a dispute on which sport is better: snowboarding or skiing. They settle the score in a down hill race. “Chilly and the fur-bearing trout”: Chilly Willy attempts to capture himself the elusive fur-bearing trout so that he can get himself a nice, warm, coat. “Painfaker”: Mr Walrus is charged with nursing Woody back to health after he injures him in the park. A camera man accompanies them to ensure the court ruling is adhered to. “Pinheads”: Woody’s experiencing car trouble in the middle of nowhere. He spots a new car but has to beat Buzz Buzzard in 10 Pin Bowling to raise the necessary funds. “The Chilly show”: Chilly becomes the star attraction in a wildlife show. “Silent treatment”: Woody’s neighbour Wally is having a bbq and Woody is determined to get an invite. Wally is determined he can ignore him.

results.title: Sport in Australia
results.creator_credit: Cinesound, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Eric Thompson
results.brief_description: A review of sports - tennis, golf, cricket, swimming, athletics. In all these fields Australia has produced a consistent line of champions - Adrian Quist, Kel Nagle, Sir Donald Bradman, Dawn Frazer, John Landy. Sport is an integral part of school education where natural talent combine with sound teaching to produce future champions. Australian Rules Football is the most popular spectator sport.

results.title: Sport for all: a million pounds worth of value
results.creator_credit: Martin H Sugarman, Sports Council, Adrian Metcalfe and Robert Malcolm
results.brief_description: Shows the impact of a thriving multi-use indoor sports centre on a local community. One such centre is Carlton Forum in Nottingham, whereby harnessing additional capital to that received for school facilities, it became possible to build a new social recreational centre to serve the community as a whole. Many of the sports and recreational activities catered for at Carlton Forum are featured with the reactions of people who use its wide range of facilities.
